meanings.definition: Repeat or prolong an action, thought, or utterance after the stimulus that prompted it has ceased.
meanings.sent1: She kept perseverating on the same idea long after the meeting ended.
meanings.sent2: He tends to perseverate on past mistakes, unable to move forward.
meanings.sent3: The cat was perseverating on chasing its tail, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a broken record, perseverating on the same worries over and over.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sunset was so beautiful that it kept her mind perseverating on its beauty.

meanings.definition: To continue a particular activity or task in a repetitive or obsessive manner.
meanings.sent1: The child was perseverating on drawing circles on the paper.
meanings.sent2: She tends to perseverate on organizing her desk, making sure everything is in its place.
meanings.sent3: The robot was perseverating on cleaning the same spot repeatedly, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like a hamster wheel, perseverating on the same problem without finding a solution.
meanings.sent5: The catchy tune kept playing in his head, causing him to perseverate on the melody all day.
